body_html:
The upgrade process is completely managed by PIP package manager.
PIP is just a tool we use to deliver tensorflow.
Unfortunately, it at times has bugs. Looks like you ran into one of these.
It looks like TF actually upgraded, but pip was not able to record the metadata correctly.

If you are not using virtualenv, you may need to use "sudo" to when running pip. If you are in a virtualenv, make sure you did not accidentally run pip command with sudo previously.
Also, most pip issues are resolved when you rerun the command.

Finally, as this looks like a PIP issue, there is not much we can do to help with this.
You can try reporting an issue to pypi, through http://pypi.org

If you are not using virtualenv, you may need to use "sudo" to when running pip. If you are in a virtualenv, make sure you did not accidentally run pip command with sudo previously.
Also, most pip issues are resolved when you rerun the command.
Finally, as this looks like a PIP issue, there is not much we can do to help with this.

body:
The upgrade process is completely managed by PIP package manager.
PIP is just a tool we use to deliver tensorflow.
Unfortunately, it at times has bugs. Looks like you ran into one of these.
It looks like TF actually upgraded, but pip was not able to record the metadata correctly.

If you are not using virtualenv, you may need to use "sudo" to when running pip. If you are in a virtualenv, make sure you did not accidentally run pip command with sudo previously.
Also, most pip issues are resolved when you rerun the command.

Finally, as this looks like a PIP issue, there is not much we can do to help with this.
You can try reporting an issue to pypi, through http://pypi.org
